alert.note: Alert for Auglaize (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 4:46PM EDT until August 20 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Central Ohio, including the following counties, Auglaize, Logan and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 446 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Newport, Anna, Fort Loramie, Jackson Center, Russells Point, Botkins, Lakeview, Chippewa Park, Kettlersville, Montra, Swanders, Mccartyville, New Hampshire, Lake Loramie State Park and Houston.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
